definition: to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳

sentences.english: But I am unable to relate the thrill and secrecy that subtle instant holds for me.
sentences.chinese: 但我無法描述那微妙的瞬間頃刻產生的震撼和神祕。

sentences.english: In fact, it is one that will shake him-and many others-to the core.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，真相讓他和很多人內心深處受到極大震撼。

sentences.english: Zheng Xiaoying's this awareness has greatly shocked me.
sentences.chinese: 鄭小瑛的這種認識極大地震撼了我。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the distant and melancholy vibration of a clock shook the panes.
sentences.chinese: 令人悵惘的鐘聲忽然從遠處傳來，震撼着窗上的玻璃。

sentences.english: Shocking the mathematical circles, it also arouses far-fLung and fervency interest all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 震撼數學界的歷史事件引起世界各界廣泛熱烈關注。

sentences.english: Thunder roared and shook the earth.
Nobody foresaw the seismic events of the next eight years.
sentences.chinese: 沒人會想到接下8年的連串震撼性事件。

sentences.english: We love the thrill of the unknown.
sentences.chinese: 我們喜歡未知帶給我們的震撼。

sentences.english: I wrote that down after I read it. It struck me as something important.
sentences.chinese: 讀完這幾句，我就把它們抄下了，並深深地爲之震撼。

sentences.english: And I was struck, as many visitors are, by the transformation that had taken place.
sentences.chinese: 我像很多來訪者一樣，被今昔的變化所震撼。

sentences.english: Yet God has begun a great shakedown in our legal system.
sentences.chinese: 開始在我們的司法體系有一個很大的震撼。

sentences.english: Critics say he mishandled the sex-abuse scandal that has rocked the Roman Catholic Church.
sentences.chinese: 也有人認爲他對震撼羅馬天主教會的性醜聞處理不當。

sentences.english: The music of the tide is rising high. You are shaken by the fever of that dance.
sentences.chinese: 浪潮高卷，轟鳴接天，熱烈的狂舞震撼着你。

sentences.english: The propagandizing items for anti-drug are most effective, and there are lots of people visiting.
sentences.chinese: 這次禁毒的宣傳品很有震撼力，參觀的人很多。

sentences.english: Hao Bin as Eros, meanwhile, left everybody astonished.
sentences.chinese: 而郝斌飾演的愛神給人留下了震撼的映像。

definition: to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
(idiom) to experience it for oneself/to actually *be* there (as opposed to reading about it etc)
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
